field_edited_text.value:
ENGINEERING PROCEDURE

The engineering work involved in this construction program has been
divided into the following three phases of engineering:

I. Preliminary work.
II. Contract plans and specifications.
ITI. Supervision of construction.

I. Preliminary work includes the following engineering steps:

(1)
(2)
3)

(4)
(5)

(6)
(7)

(8)

Supervision of complete topographical surveys at the sites of the
crossings.

Supervision of subsurface investigations at the sites of the

crossings.

Studies to determine the exact crossing locations, based upon the
results of the topographic surveys, the subsurface explorations,
and the value and type of property damages at each crossing.

Studies to develop the needs and requirements of navigation in-
terests in the location of each crossing.

Studies and estimates to develop the comparative engineering
economics, as between various types of construction at each
crossing.

The development of War Department Permit Drawings, and at-
tendance at War Department Hearings.

Preliminary plans and specifications developed to the extent re-
quired for the determination of accurate quantities of construec-
tion materials.

The development of comprehensive estimates of cost based upon
a study of material sources of supply, labor conditions, and
general economic conditions which might affect construction
costs within the period of time required for the completion of
each crossing. These estimates of cost to include interest aceru-
ing upon the bonds prior to the commencement of and during
the construction of each crossing, and for six months after com-
pletion of construction, with reasonable fees of the fiscal agents
for the payment of such interest; the cost of Indemnity and Fi-
delity Bonds for securing deposits in the construction fund;
fees and expenses of the trustee during construction; engineering
costs for traffic studies; engineering costs for surveys, estimates,
borings, preliminary investigations, preparation of plans, super-
vising construction, and complete engineering throughout; legal
